title: Poncho, 20th century
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique: warp-face plain weave patterned by warp stripes and warp ikat. Two strand twining on groups of warps at each end of neck slit. Neck slit is in the warp direction formed by discontinuous weft.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 144 x 129.5 cm (56 11/16 x 51 in.)
description: Poncho with neck slit in center patterned by three broad stripes, each with a continuous geometric symmetrical repeat isolated by narrow white stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
